title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: Does the expression match any of these formats: $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x$$ + $$b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x+b\right)}^2$$, $${\left(a x\right)}^2-2a b x+b^2$$ $$=$$ $${\left(a x-b\right)}^2$$ ? Yes.

title: Factor the Perfect Square
text: In this case, we can see that $$25n^2+20n+4$$ as $${\left(a x\right)}^2+2a b x+b^2={\left(ax+b\right)}^2$$ where $$ax=5n$$ and $$b=2$$. We can factor $$25n^2+20n+4$$ as $${\left(5n+2\right)}^2$$.
speech: In this case, we can see that  25 n squared, plus 20 n plus, 4  as , parentheses a x  squared plus, 2 a b x, plus b squared is equal to parentheses, a x plus b,  squared  where  a x is equal to, 5 n  and  b, is equal to 2 . We can factor  25 n squared plus 20 n plus 4  as , parentheses, 5 n plus 2,  squared .

title: Rewrite the Equation
speech: We can rewrite  25 n squared, plus 20 n plus 4 is equal to 18  as , parentheses, 5 n plus 2,  squared is equal to 18 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(5n+2\right)}^2=18$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$5n+2=\sqrt{18}$$ and $$5n+2=-\sqrt{18}$$.
speech: The square root property: if  x squared  , is equal to,  k, then  x  , is equal to   the square root of k , or  x   is equal to  , negative the square root of k , or  x   is equal to the square root of k . , parentheses, 5 n plus 2,  squared is equal to, 18 , we can take square root both sides and get  5 n, plus 2 is equal to the square root of 18  and  5 n plus 2 is equal to, negative the square root of 18 .

title: Solve for $$n$$ in $$5n+2=\sqrt{18}$$
text: What is $$n$$ when $$5n+2=-\sqrt{18}$$? Simplify the square root as much as possible.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$25n^2+20n+4=18$$ has two solutions which are $$n=\frac{2}{5}+\frac{3}{5} \sqrt{2}$$ and $$n=\frac{2}{5}-\frac{3}{5} \sqrt{2}$$.
speech: Therefore,  25 n squared, plus 20 n plus 4 is equal to 18  has two solutions which are  n, is equal to 2 fifths plus, 3 fifths the square root of 2  and  n is equal to 2 fifths minus, 3 fifths the square root of 2 .
